contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=March 2010}} The [[National Association for the Advancement of Colored People]] presents an annual [[NAACP Image Award]]. The following are winners for the '''President's Award''': <!-- If anybody can find more info on this, *please* add it. --> {| class="wikitable" |- ! Year ! Winner |- | 1988 | [[Rev. Jesse Jackson]] |- | 1990 | [[Antoinette Stroman]] & [[Ryan White]] |- | 1996 | [[Kent Amos]] & [[Carmen Amos]] |- | 1997 | [[Bryant Gumbel]] |- | 1998 | [[Alexis Herman]]<ref name="Gray">{{cite web|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117468335?refcatid=13&printerfriendly=true|title=NAACP Image nods to 'Soul Food,' 'Touched'|last=Gray|first=Timothy M.|date=Mar. 3, 1998|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|accessdate=16 April 2012}}</ref> |- | 1999 | [[Lauryn Hill]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/news/will-hill-win-fill-of-naacp-honors-946715.story#/news/will-hill-win-fill-of-naacp-honors-946715.story|title=Will & Hill Win Fill Of NAACP Honors|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|accessdate=16 April 2012}}</ref> |- | 2000 | [[Tavis Smiley]] and [[Tom Joyner]] |- | 2001 | [[Bill Clinton]] |- | 2002 | [[Condoleezza Rice]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1310&dat=20020225&id=fExWAAAAIBAJ&sjid=9OsDAAAAIBAJ&pg=3750,6599637|title=NAACP Recognizes Rice|date=Feb 25, 2002|work=[[Eugene Register-Guard]]|accessdate=16 April 2012}}</ref> |- | 2003 | [[Venus Williams|Venus]] and [[Serena Williams]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/news/la-ca-2008-image5_ke9a5znc,0,7199948.photo|title=Serena and Venus Williams|publisher=[[LA Times]]|accessdate=16 April 2012}}</ref> |- | 2004 | [[T. D. Jakes]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aframnews.com/html/2004-02-04/feat2.htm|title=Bishop T.D. Jakes will be given the President’s Award|publisher=aframnews.com|accessdate=16 April 2012}}</ref> |- | 2006 | [[Susan L. Taylor]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.naacpimageawards.net/37thImageAwards/nominees.html|title=Welcome To The NAACP Image Awards|publisher=NAACP|accessdate=16 April 2012}}</ref> |- | 2007 | [[Soledad O'Brien]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.naacpimageawards.net/PDFs/2006PresidentAward.pdf|title=SOLEDAD O'BRIEN TO RECEIVE PRESIDENT'S AWARD. AT 38th NAACP IMAGE AWARDS|publisher=NAACP|accessdate=16 April 2012}}</ref> |- | 2008 | [[Ruby Dee]] |- | 2009 | [[Muhammad Ali]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.naacpimageawards.net/40/releases/40th_nia_presidents_award_ali.pdf|title=The legendary Muhammad Ali will receive the NAACPâ€™s 2009 President's Award at the 40TH NAACP IMAGE AWARDS, broadcast live from 8-10 p.m. ET (PT tape-delayed) Feb. 12 on FOX, NAACP President-CEO Ben Jealous announced today.|date=February 3, 2009|publisher=NAACP|accessdate=16 April 2012}}</ref> |- | 2010 | [[Van Jones]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://naacpblogs.naacp.org/blog/?p=453 |first=Benjamin Todd |last=Jealous |title=Van Jones Will Receive This Year's NAACP President's Award. Here's Why |date=February 24, 2010 |accessdate=2010-02-25 |publisher=NAACP}}</ref> |- | 2011 | [[Colin Powell]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.naacpimageawards.net/42/nominees-and-honorees/presidents-award/|title=President's Award|publisher=NAACP|accessdate=16 April 2012}}</ref> |- | 2012 | The Black Stuntmen's Association<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.naacpimageawards.net/43/winners-and-honorees/presidents-award/|title=President's Award|publisher=NAACP|accessdate=16 April 2012}}</ref> |} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{NAACP Image Awards}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Naacp Image Award - President's Award}} [[Category:NAACP Image Awards]] 2013 Kerry Washington
